meanings.definition: A subatomic particle that is composed of one quark and one antiquark.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study mesons to understand their structure.
meanings.sent2: Mesons play a crucial role in the field of particle physics.
meanings.sent3: The mesons at the party were the life of the subatomic gathering.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between the quark and antiquark in mesons is like a dance of opposites.
meanings.sent5: The classroom buzzed with excitement as the teacher introduced mesons to the students.

meanings.definition: A type of boson that mediates the strong nuclear force.
meanings.sent1: Mesons are carriers of the strong nuclear force.
meanings.sent2: The interaction between mesons and other particles is fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The mesons in the nucleus were busy keeping everything together.
meanings.sent4: In the world of particles, mesons are the glue that holds things in place.
meanings.sent5: The power of mesons in the atomic realm is truly remarkable.

meanings.definition: Particles that are intermediate in mass between electrons and protons.
meanings.sent1: Mesons have a mass that falls between electrons and protons.
meanings.sent2: The discovery of mesons helped fill the gap in particle physics.
meanings.sent3: The mesons in the scale model of atoms were perfectly sized.
meanings.sent4: In the cosmic orchestra, mesons provide the middle notes between electrons and protons.
meanings.sent5: The weight of mesons in the subatomic world is just right for their role.
